body_html:
It shouldn't affect the C++ builds because they don't include python_headers.h

push_macro is a pragma, if the compiler doesn't know it, it will be ignored.

In this case, we just let Python.h set the _XOPEN_SOURCE thing.

So for user to see a failure, we'd need:

  1. the compiler doesn't support push_macro
  2. somehow the undef/redef of _XOPEN_SOURCE actually matters.

That seems pretty unlikely to me.

body:
It shouldn't affect the C++ builds because they don't include python_headers.h

push_macro is a pragma, if the compiler doesn't know it, it will be ignored.

In this case, we just let Python.h set the _XOPEN_SOURCE thing.

So for user to see a failure, we'd need:
1. the compiler doesn't support push_macro
2. somehow the undef/redef of _XOPEN_SOURCE actually matters.

That seems pretty unlikely to me.
